result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse E. Taylor

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 9:14 a.m. 
Clerk Heather.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Defendant FAILS to appear, with Atty Joseph Kaupie in person.

Atty Kaupie indicates his client has been in the hospital for the past week and requests the COURT to not issue a warrant and forfeit bond.
COURT holds BFH in abeyance, leaves PTC on and requires proof of hospital visit.

DATES to remain.

Adjourned: 9:16 a.m.
Pre-trial conference on November 16, 2022 at 10:20 am.
Amended to add case 22CM919 and increase cap to $1,000 onto cover both files. Payment as previously ordered
Order Appointing Counsel - Amended (Includes 22CF751 and 22CM919)

INCLUDES 22CM919 & 22CF751.  No contact with victim C.M.B. unless waived in writing at the DAs office.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 9:32 a.m. 
INCLUDES: 22CM919, 22CF751.
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski; Defendant appears in person with Atty Joseph Kaupie.
Date and time set for an indigency hearing.

Defendant has obtained counsel and requests a warrant quash.
Atty Kaupie makes statement re: missed appearance, requests the warrant to be quashed in both cases.
COURT QUASHES WARRANTS.
ADA Vechinski makes bond arguments.
COURT addresses parties.
COURT orders $1,000.00 signature bond to cover both files with same conditions as originally ordered, vacates forfeiture of prior bond.
Atty Kaupie requests his appointment to be extended to the 22CM919 file. 
Defendant sworn in and testifies. 
Court finds defendant indigent;
COURT appoints Atty Joseph Kaupie @ $100/hr not to exceed $1,000.00 to cover both files, w/o further order;

DATES:
CC: 10/12/22 @ 1:00 p.m. 

Adjourned: 9:45 a.m.

Clerk: Heather.

State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person, pro se.

Deft sworn and testifies re: finances. 
Court appts Atty Joseph Kaupie @ $100/hr. not to exceed $500 w/o further order of the Court.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse E. Taylor
Current: 416 1/2 South 4th Ave., Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 07-21-2022)

Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (2) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.   Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 3:17 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Defendant appears in person, pro se. 

**WARRANT QUASHED**

Complaint read. Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA: Not Guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: $300 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. 
- Prints and photograph. 

Deft's phone number: 715-303-9502. 

BRANCH 3 CASE. 
PTC with JA: 8/18/2022 at 10:15 am. 
FPT: 9/12/2022 at 3:20 pm. 
Jury Status Review: 9/26/2022 at 10:20 am. 
Jury Trial: 10/20/2022 at 9am.
